content: May 4 (Reuters) - Frankfurt Airport operator Fraport on Thursday said its core profit more than doubled in the first quarter, boosted by ongoing traffic recovery across its global network of airports.

The group, which operates at 28 airports around the world, said its earnings before interest, taxation, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) rose to 158.3 million euros ($175.4 million) in the quarter, from 70.7 million euros a year earlier. This was still 21% below the pre-pandemic 2019 figure. ($1 = 0.9024 euros) (Reporting by Anna Mackenzie and Anastasiia Kozlova in Gdansk; Editing by Milla Nissi)
